questiontext.text:
Exercise

Concentric circles of radii \({@ic@}\) cm and \({@mc@}\) cm are drawn on a circular target of radius \({@oc@}\) cm. A darts player receives \(10\), \(5\) or \(3\) points for hitting the target inside the smaller circle, middle annular region and outer annular region respectively. The player has only a \(50/50\) chance of hitting the target at all but if they do hit it they are just as likely to hit any one point on it as any other. If \(X=\) 'number of points scored on a single throw of a dart', calculate the expected value of \(X\).

Write your answer as a rational number (fraction).  

\(\text{E}(X)=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

\(X\) can take 4 values 0, 3, 5 or 10 \[\text{P}(X=0)=0.5\qquad \text{[only 50/50 chance of hitting target]}\] The probability that a particular points score is obtained is related to the areas of the annular regions which are, from the centre: \({@ic@}^2\times \pi = {@ai@},\ ({@mc@}^2-{@ic@}^2)\times \pi={@am@},\ ({@oc@}^2-{@mc@}^2)\times \pi={@ao@}\) \[\begin{aligned} \text{P}(X=3\phantom{0})&=\text{P}[(3\ \text{is scored})\cap (\text{target is hit})]\\ \\ &=\text{P}(3\ \text{is scored}\,|\,\text{target is hit})\times\text{P}(\text{target is hit})\\ \\ &=\dfrac{{@ao@}}{{@at@}}.\dfrac{1}{2}={@eo@}\\ \\ \text{P}(X=5\phantom{0})&=\text{P}(5\ \text{is scored}\,|\,\text{target is hit})\times\text{P}(\text{target is hit})\\ \\ &=\dfrac{{@am@}}{{@ao@}i}.\dfrac{1}{2}={@em@}\\ \\ \text{P}(X=10)&=\text{P}(10\ \text{is scored}\,|\,\text{target is hit})\times\text{P}(\text{target is hit})\\ \\ &=\dfrac{{@ai@}}{{@at@}}.\dfrac{1}{2}={@ei@}\end{aligned}\] \[\therefore \qquad \text{E}(X)={@op@}\times{@eo@}+{@mp@}\times{@em@}+{@ip@}\times{@ei@} = {@ta1@}\]
